author: Morgan Park
description: The elusive revolver blueprint is easiest to find in raider containers, which are easy to find if you know where to look.
title: This is where I found the Anvil blueprint in Arc Raiders

author: Wes Fenlon
description: Sweet dreams, Steam Deck.
title: Finally! The Steam Deck can now download games in a new 'display-off, low-power' mode before automatically going to sleep

author: Jody Macgregor
description: You will believe a man can sit at a desk.
title: Telltale-style adventures are back: Dispatch has sold more than a million copies in 10 days

author: Andy Chalk
description: Grand Theft Auto did actually go to London, but it was in 1999 for the original GTA—and the series never returned
title: Rockstar co-founder Dan Houser says there's a reason the Grand Theft Auto games are always set in US cities: 'Guns'

author: Jody Macgregor
description: Her card's as unpredictable as she is.
title: Bend fire and lightning with Avatar's Azula in Magic: The Gathering

author: Tyler Wilde
description: Amazon's New World wouldn't have to die if the company actually wanted to be an MMO developer.
title: The tech industry came for Steam and whiffed so hard that it's had to admit that it didn't even really like making games in the first place

author: Wes Fenlon
description: TFW you have F'd around, and then found out.
title: My favorite genre of Arc Raiders videos so far is people discovering why Leapers are called that

author: Christopher Livingston
description: It's also decently cheap and the profits go to a great cause.
title: Balatro's new merch is just as unhinged as we've come to expect

author: Rich Stanton
description: This film is underrated and no, I will not be taking questions.
title: Director Paul WS Anderson says you can blame Metal Gear Solid for the Monster Hunter movie, because juxtaposing machine guns and monsters is simply 'great imagery'

author: Andy Chalk
description: T-Minus Zero, which lost its NetEase backing in September, has been acquired and relaunched by a group of industry veterans.
title: One of the studios NetEase killed earlier this year is back from the dead as an 'independent production company,' but its original boss is nowhere to be seen

author: Tyler Colp
description: WoW will remain a PC game first and foremost.
title: World of Warcraft director says it's not getting easier in Midnight because it's coming to consoles: 'There's no reason for us to hide anything about this'

author: Kerry Brunskill
description: Ghouls, ghosts, and a good old-fashioned whodunit.
title: The Séance of Blake Manor review

author: Sean Martin
description: A purple everytime, plus blue weapons, and rare upgrade materials.
title: I think I've found the best early loot spot in Arc Raiders and nobody seems to know about it

author: Andy Chalk
description: It took five months and "meticulous" planning to put together the lore-accurate recreation of Frodo's epic quest to destroy the One Ring.
title: Lord of the Rings Online player accurately recreates Frodo's journey to Mount Doom in 10-hour YouTube video: 'When I saw how perfectly the game followed Tolkien's imagination, I decided to do it properly'

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: It has been 0 days without dwarven baby disasters.
title: 'The return of baby driver': The Dwarf Fortress Siege Update briefly reintroduced an old bug where dwarf babies pilot their moms like mech suits until they die of dehydration because babies don't know what drinking is

author: Andy Edser
description: People power.
title: Arc Raiders and Battlefield 6 prove that great performance and low system requirements are king for multiplayer PC games in 2025

author: Rick Lane
description: Most of the developers surveyed were C-suite level.
title: Study says only 72% of game developers reckon that Steam has a monopoly on PC games, and even with some big caveats, it makes me wonder what the other 28% are thinking

author: James Bentley
description: Copyright is pretty big to a major publisher, in case you can't tell.
title: Japan's biggest publishing house and one of the world's largest manga producers takes aim at OpenAI, accusing it of 'trampling on the dignity of artists'

author: Dave James
description: These are the components we think offer the best bang for buck today.
title: The kit filter: The perfect parts for building your first gaming PC

author: Jeremy Laird
description: So fast it Hz.
title: Give it up for the MCHOSE Ace 68 Turbo, the world's first 16 kHz keyboard and surely the last word in technological overkill

author: Nick Evanson
description: I worry about powering the sole GPU that's in my gaming rig, so that means I'm bonding with Microsoft, right?
title: If Microsoft can't source enough electricity to power all the AI GPUs it has, you have to wonder how Amazon is going to cope in its new $38 billion deal with OpenAI

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Cast your eyes upon this gently lukewarm thing.
title: Toasty CPU? This microwave PC build demonstrates that you ain't seen nothing yet

author: Mollie Taylor
description: Turns out "day one" was several years and eight delays away.
title: Approximately 2,555 days after a 'day one' giveaway, people are finally receiving copies of a game they won 7 years ago

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Words hurt, you know.
title: British MPs are comparing one another to Cliff Bleszinski's dead live-service FPS LawBreakers to score points as videogame debate comes to UK Parliament

author: Rick Lane
description: A Teaching moment.
title: Civilization 7's latest update brings a sweeping balance pass and a broadside of naval mechanics, while Firaxis offers Blackbeard for free as a 'special thanks' to players

author: Jeremy Laird
description: This 11-inch 'handheld' PC is bigger than my laptop...
title: I've been playing with the 'world's first' glasses-free 3D handheld PC and my early impressions are that the $1,500 Abxylute 3D One is absolutely huge, annoyingly clunky and a little bit silly

author: Elie Gould
description: Concord is quickly becoming shorthand for 'messed-up videogame launch'.
title: 'Gamers deserve clarity': UK Parliament debates videogame ownership while also beating the dead horse named Concord

author: Nick Evanson
description: The little satellite is sadly no more, but it will hold its place in gaming history forever.
title: The 25th anniversary of the ISS operationally in orbit reminded me the ESA once challenged an Assassin's Creed and Far Cry dev to get DOOM running on a satellite

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Though I suspect the new owners care a lot more about money than anything else.
title: EA pinky promises to 'maintain creative control' in its post-buyout era, but the list of 'cultural values' it plans to keep doesn't mean much at all

author: Rory Norris
description: And other methods to save time packing.
title: I was fighting my inventory more than enemies in Arc Raiders until I discovered the magic space-saving button

author: Mollie Taylor
description: Targeting potential "crab hand" gestures has caught out several companies in South Korea.
title: Stellar Blade studio swears it wasn't doing anti-small-penis 'hate speech' in art that had men in a tizz, and promises it won't ever 'tolerate' it in future

author: Rory Norris
description: All the guns you should keep an eye out for topside.
title: Best weapons in Arc Raiders

author: Rick Lane
description: Revamps how enemies attack your fortress, and how you can defend it.
title: Dwarf Fortress' Siege Update is out now, renewing Bay 12 Games' quest to create a simulation more complex than life itself

author: Robin Valentine
description: The aptly named Warhammer Survivors features, unusually, both the Warhammer 40,000 and Warhammer: Age of Sigmar settings in one game.
title: This new Warhammer roguelike from the developer of Boltgun is also the official next game in the Vampire Survivors series

author: Andy Edser
description: It's still not cheap, but seriously impressive nonetheless.
title: The fastest RTX 5080 gaming laptop we've ever tested has over $1,000 knocked off the price

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Trust issues.
title: Windows 'update and shut down' reboot glitch finally fixed, saving tiny gaming laptop batteries everywhere

author: Kara Phillips
description: Finally, my home is safe.
title: Creepers have no power over you now, someone has made a mod which forces them to ask you for permission before they explode

author: Kara Phillips
description: Making Minecraft a hoot.
title: I was baffled when I found out Minecraft's most popular Marketplace mod just adds owls—but now I've tried it, I can't live without it

author: Elie Gould
description: There's a security camera in the toilets.
title: The Mailroom is a scarier version of Papers, Please, set in the Devil's corporate office that's full of frogs and toilet paper

author: Joshua Wolens
description: You've got until November 7 to make your opinion known.
title: The Golden Joystick Awards has published its shortlist of 12 games that could take home its Ultimate Game of the Year trophy, and voting's open now

author: Robert Jones
description: 'Boom! Clap clep clop'
title: Legendary FPS maker John Romero delivers the objectively correct answer when voting for the most satisfying weapon in gaming history: 'I strongly agree, Mr Romero'

author: Morgan Park
description: It's impolite to shoot at others in Arc Raiders, which is surprising for an extraction shooter but also beautiful.
title: 'One of the chillest communities I’ve ever encountered': Arc Raiders solos are choosing love over war, and it's beautiful

author: Wes Fenlon
description: The Undertale-inspired Stray Children, like Kimura's '90s RPG Moon, is part oddball story, part genre commentary.
title: After being inspired by Toby Fox to make his first RPG in decades, cult developer Yoshiro Kimura couldn't help but make it weird: 'Some people are going to look at it and go that's kind of odd, but that's just the way my games turn out'
